titleInfo.title: Letter No 33 of 1823 from John Macleod, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushere [Bushire] to William Newnham, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter concerns the rebuilding of forts on the Arabian coast, specifically referring to Sooltan bin Suggur's [Sulṭān bin Saqr] efforts to rebuild fortifications at Rasel Khyma [Ra's al-Khaymah] and Sharga [Sharjah]. It explains that the Resident did not expect him to destroy his work, but merely to delay them pending instructions from the Bombay Government. It further explains that if the British have no right to refuse permission to Arab chiefs seeking to build fortifications on the coast, then it places the British in a difficult position with respect to preventing the re-emergence of piratical activity in the Persian Gulf.
